free_text.Learning outcomes: Learning basic knowledge on transmission of information and identify the relevant criteria for the dimensioning of a telecommunication system.  Evaluate the quality of digital transmission systems (error probability) either in baseband or shifted passband.
free_text.Content: [b]Introduction[/b][br/]Global approach. Quantity of information. Information sources: texts, voice, pictures, video.[br/][b]Transmission basics[/b][br/]Transmission quality, levels, bandwidth, distortions, perturbations, crosstalk, signal-to-noise ratio. Baseband and passband signals. Channel characteristics. Channel capacity. Sampling. Multiplexing.[br/][b]Transmission media[/b][br/]Metallic lines. Fibers. Radio waves.[br/][b]Baseband digital telecommunications systems[/b][br/]Binary and m-ary transmission. Pulse shaping. Inter symbol interference and regeneration. Eye pattern. Error probability. Dimensioning.[br/][b]Analog telecommunication systems[/b][br/]Amplification. Noise accumulation in a repeater chain. Dimensioning.[br/][b]Analog modulations[/b][br/]AM, AM-P, SSB, FM and PM.  Modulation, demodulation and bandwidth.[br/][b]Digital (discrete) modulations[/b][br/]OOK, ASK, PSK, DPSK, QAM and FSK. Constellation diagram. Bandwidth and error probability.[br/][b]Passband digital telecommunications systems[/b][br/]Link budget. Dimensioning examples.
free_text.Type of teaching: Ex cathedra with examples and demos. Exercises in class and group discussions. [br/]
free_text.Prerequisite for: Lectures, teaching labs, semester and master projects in telecommunications.[br/]
